chartCard.description: This is a static display of the exercises and levels in this chart

onboarding.title: Welcome to the 5BX App!
onboarding.introduction: To get started, please provide some basic information.
onboarding.dobExplanation: Your date of birth helps us personalize your experience and provide age-appropriate start and target exercise levels.
onboarding.nameExplanation: Your name will be used to personalize your profile and in-app communications.

validationMessages.dobTooRecent: Date of birth must be at least 6 years ago

e01.name: 1-mile Run
e01.description: Run 1 mile at a steady pace. Use a track, a fitness app or measure a route in advance to ensure accurate distance.

e02.name: 2-mile Walk
e02.description: Walk 2 miles at a steady pace. Use a fitness app or measure a route in advance to ensure accurate distance.

e1.name: Standing Forward Bend to Upward Salute Flow
e1.description: Feet astride, arms upward. Perform a forward bend to touch the floor, then stretch upward into a backward bend. Emphasis on fluid motion rather than keeping knees locked.

e2.name: Half Sit-Up (Canadian Forces Standard)
e2.description: Back lying, feet 6 inches apart. Lift head/shoulders just enough to see heels while keeping legs straight. Focused on core engagement without full sit-up range.

e3.name: Prone Alternating Leg Lift
e3.description: Front lying with palms under thighs. Alternately raise straightened legs while lifting head, ensuring thighs clear palms. Counts emphasize controlled alternation.

e4.name: Knee-Modified Full Range Push-Up
e4.description: From kneeling plank position, perform push-ups with full arm extension and chest-to-floor contact. Maintains straight line from knees to shoulders.

e5.name: High-Step Scissor Jump Combo
e5.description: Alternate between high-step stationary run and scissor switch jumps. Transition smoothly between exercises, maintaining rhythm and form.

e51.name: High-Step Stationary Run
e51.description: Stationary run counting steps each time left foot touches floor. Maintain 4-inch foot elevation. Base component for interval training.

e52.name: Scissor Switch Jumps
e52.description: From staggered stance, jump to alternate arm/leg positions mid-air. Maintain shoulder-high arm position and controlled landing.
